medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of back pain and difficulty urinating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A, a 42-year-old man, had a gradual onset of mild back pain located on both sides that resolved over a few weeks. The back pain recurred and was accompanied by difficulty and burning during urination. He experienced a severe episode of back pain that required him to miss work for a few days. The pain resolved after a few weeks. After it returned again, he sought medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Familial hypercholesterolemia for more than a decade and mild hypertension for 1 year.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather had experienced some form of abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA).
medical_history.social_history: Smoker, smoking 20 to 40 cigarettes daily since his teens.
